intro: Cephaloschoenus longirostris, commonly known as the long-beaked sedge, is a flowering plant species native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and rushes. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. It typically grows in wetland or swampy habitats, contributing to the ecological diversity of its environment.
